intro: Mormodes barbata, commonly known as the hairy mormodes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa and the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
